qas.question: Where did a group of fans demand that Everton remain within the city boundaries of?
In what year was it revealed that Everton had entered talks to build a new 55,000 seat stadium in Kirkby?
Who did Everton enter talks with to build a new 55,000 seat stadium in Kirkby?
What percentage of fans were supportive of Everton's plans to build a new stadium in 2006?
How many supporters voted on the ballot?
What was one of the local councils that opposed the planned stadium?
How many people were in the group of fans that wanted Everton to stay inside the Liverpool city boundaries?
On what date was the ballot held?

context: On <b7_0>16 June <a1_0>2006<b7_0/><a1_0/>, it was announced that Everton had entered into talks with <a2_0><b5_0>Knowsley Council<b5_0/> and Tesco<a2_0/> over the possibility of building a new <b6_0>55,000<b6_0/> seat stadium, expandable to over <b4_0>60,000<b4_0/>, in Kirkby. The club took the unusual move of giving its supporters a say in the club's future by holding a ballot on the proposal, finding a split of <a3_0>59<a3_0/>% to 41% in favour. Opponents to the plan included other local councils concerned by the effect of a large Tesco store being built as part of the development, and a group of fans demanding that Everton should remain within the city boundaries of <a0_0>Liverpool<a0_0/>.
